intro: Oerstedella pajitense, commonly known as the Pajitén orchid, is a rare and unique orchid species native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows on tree branches or rocks, exhibiting an epiphytic growth habit. Its leaves are elongated and narrow, adapted to capture moisture from the humid air. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oerstedella pajitense is considered a vulnerable species.
